title: Research Fellow CLAHRC Theme 4
text:
Job Ref: 54660 
The NIHR CLAHRC-WM is a five-year programme which started in January 2014 with a mission to create lasting and effective collaborations across health and social care organisations, universities (Birmingham, Keele, Warwick) and local authorities to improve the services we can deliver for patient benefit. 
The programme is funded for 5 years through a £10 million investment from the National Institute for Health Research (NIHR) together with a further £20.6 million matched funding provided by collaborating partners. 
There are six programmes of work: Theme 1 – Maternity and Child Health Theme 2 – Prevention and Early Intervention in Youth Mental Health Theme 3 – Prevention and Detection Theme 4 – Chronic Diseases (Integrated and Holistic Care) Theme 5 - Implementation and Organisational Studies Theme 6 - Research Methods 
We are looking to recruit an additional Research Fellow to join the team in Theme 4. The post holder will lead/contribute to undertaking health service evaluation research projects in collaboration with local NHS Trusts and Local Authorities, and developing proposals for external research funding. The current team consists of 2.8wte Research Fellows, a 0.6wte Research team leader and a full-time Project support post. You will be based at the University of Birmingham, and the research projects you will work on are likely to include some travel within the West Midlands. 
Applications from candidates with NHS experience, either as a clinician or as a manager, will be especially welcomed, as the postholder will need to be able to navigate the health and social care system and engage with professional staff. For the grade 8 post, we are looking for applicants who have a good publication record and have had some success in applying for research grants (previous applicants for the grade 8 post advertised in July need not apply). 
We have a number of research projects underway across the West Midlands, including: a review of systematic review evidence on integrated care; evaluation of a new trauma pathway for older people; research into the emotional and psychological support needs of end-stage renal patients; an evaluation of a supported integrated discharge service; and an evaluation of tools used to predict the risk of hospital re-admissions. 
We are a friendly and welcoming team and you will have opportunities to extend your skill set and develop your academic career. For further details of the CLAHRC and of the work of theme 4: www.clahrc-wm.nihr.ac.uk. Informal enquiries to Gill Combes: g.combes@bham.ac.uk . 
Interview Date: 28 October 2015 
To download the details of this position and submit an electronic application online please click on the Apply Online button below, please quote Job Reference in all enquiries. Alternatively information can be obtained from: www.hr.bham.ac.uk/jobs
